channel.title: Not realy that inportant but i just need some confermation
channel.description:
ok well i got this idea today while i was eating a chiken leg at lunch with my mates , so here it is:
you go to the bank and take out a loan of 10k and do the same from about 9 other banks so you got 100 grand right? so i was thinking if you go to another bank and put the 100 grand in there and then the other 10 loans you took out get them to take 10 pound per a day from the bank were you have the money in. What im trying to say is will the intrest of the 100grand be able to pay off the 10 loans? btw you can take out a 6 grand loan without a job if you live with your parents :\ so will it work?
btw sorry if any of my spellings or other shit like that is wrong because my comp is well shit, you could do more with a pen and a note pad.

item.title: Not realy that inportant but i just need some confermation
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Bobby:

yah, you have to pay off what you can. this includes them reping stuff and putting a lein on your pay

No, just what you have in cash. You give them what you got on the spot, then you don’t get NO more hassle. At least in the UK, however I would think it is the same in the USA, read up about it here.

Read full topic

item.title: Not realy that inportant but i just need some confermation
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Bobby:

where i live, the us, if you own a soemthing, the creditors can make you sell it ( i think)

That sucks, the UK equivalent, at least, I think is baylifts, but it works different, if you let them in once, they can come back and take what you like, but if they don’t go in the house(legally or illegally), they can’t take anything. But when I mean bankruptcy cancels debt, it’s gone, finished, doesn’t exist no more. You pay off what you can then it’s finished.

Read full topic

item.title: Not realy that inportant but i just need some confermation
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Bobby, post:16, topic:144800”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=198398.msg1768548#msg1768548 date=1190268017]
You guys know, you can plan bankruptcy and end up better off than you was before?

Take a trip down to your Citizens Advice Center, read up about debt.
[/quote]

only if you don’town anyhting nor are planning to get a loan in the next 10 ish years[/quote]

Do you know what bankruptcy is? Lets say your in $4m debt to shops, if you go bankrupt, that debt magically goes away. I live in England so I can’t say it will work this way, but for us, the only debt we keep is the council tax, electric, water, gas ect. Everything else is dropped.

Read full topic

item.title: Not realy that inportant but i just need some confermation
item.dc:creator: @Starblaster100 Starblaster100
item.description:
@Starblaster100 wrote:

Well if you live in the UK, you can do the following… I’m sure other countries do a similar thing.

If you are a student (which i am sure many of you are) go to as many banks as you can and open a student bank account with them. With student accounts, you can a £500 overdraft, interest free. Take out your overdraft from each bank and put them into ISAs (Savings accounts) That way you build up shit loads of interest, and your loans don’t increase.

When you’ve made a lot off of the interest, simply pay your overdrafts back. Hey presto. Free cash

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @wixter wixter
item.description:
@wixter wrote:

Use a calculator, they probly wont let you pay back 10 pound a day, they’l do it monthly, you’l have interest to pay back on top of the 10g’s you take out, you wont start earning interest on that 100grand for awhile. I doubt it would work mate.

Read full topic
